item.title: What are Supply Chain Attacks and how to mitigate them
item.description: What’s a Supply Chain Attack? Basically it’s when a malicious actor swaps one of the software components with a compromised one. Nowadays, the great majority of consumer-facing software, such as webapps or mobile apps, make use of third party software components in the form of libraries. For example, this standard app makes use of components such as Searcher, Monitoring, Math, etc. These components are created, by third party organizations, often by individuals from the open source community.
